old.desc:
Here is a new question format.  What I think we can do is replace the coach jack questions with this style, but instead of open text LLM questions we can ask the couple of missing questions from CJ, Event duration or whatever is missing but used in the rules.

[https://claude.ai/public/artifacts/9295a409-89be-4ddf-a7d7-5a1ed38e8e13](https://claude.ai/public/artifacts/9295a409-89be-4ddf-a7d7-5a1ed38e8e13 "smartCard-inline")

So for AI version we will add LLM open text questions.  I think the question about how much are you training now can be skipped if they connect to strava, right?

I am getting Henry to design this visually in a style that better matches TD.

Remember these questions will need to live in borderless browser view in the app as soon as we have the AI/LLM part working.

card.desc:
Here is a new question format.  What I think we can do is replace the coach jack questions with this style, but instead of open text LLM questions we can ask the couple of missing questions from CJ, Event duration or whatever is missing but used in the rules.

[https://claude.ai/public/artifacts/9295a409-89be-4ddf-a7d7-5a1ed38e8e13](https://claude.ai/public/artifacts/9295a409-89be-4ddf-a7d7-5a1ed38e8e13 "smartCard-inline")

So for AI version we will add LLM open text questions.  I think the question about how much are you training now can be skipped if they connect to strava, right?

I am getting Henry to design this visually in a style that better matches TD.

Remember these questions will need to live in borderless browser view in the app as soon as we have the AI/LLM part working.

We should save all the users choices and text they write and never discard it or over write it, although we could retain the history in more of a log format and just have the current info.  Overall they will have their original answers and incremental updates, although they will be able to start over and we show their original choices and they can over write those but I think it is still a good idea to retain the history as over time we can see how people evolve and eventually make AI much smarter.

old.desc:
‌

![image.png](https://trello.com/1/cards/6839987a9c022be4f2eb7b0c/attachments/683998bab8f9a9823ee6d636/download/image.png)

‌

‌

Some people want hard workouts from the beginning of the block. In some cases means staying with the original nature of the plan like doing 4X5s for 8 weeks. Hard start plans can drive more rapid initial increases, but do come with more risk.

‌

**Recommend:** Progressive blocks start at moderate efforts and build up.  This can support the best long term progress.

card.name: UI Ideas - V1

old.desc:
1. **User Data Collection (Text-Based Intake)**

- User is prompted: "Tell us everything about you."
- Free-text input encouraged (background, goals, constraints, training style).
- LLM parses text and outputs structured **User Tags** grouped into categories:
  - Goals
  - Training Experience
  - Schedule Constraints
  - Motivation Style
  - Preferences (intensity, outdoor/indoor, etc.)

---

1. **Tag Completion Check**

- LLM checks for **missing or unclear tags**.
- Asks follow-up questions to complete the user profile.
- Reprocesses to **refine User Tags**.

---

1. **Periodization Model Selection**

- Based on the user's goals, experience, and training habits, the system proposes a **periodization model**.
- Options may include:
  - The Traditionalist
  - The Off-Season Sharpener
  - The Year-Round Performer
  - The Plateau-Buster
  - The Multi-Peak Specialist
  - The Phased Performer
- The selected model helps guide the structure and sequence of training phases.

---

1. **Block Recommendation Engine**

- All training blocks in the system have pre-assigned metadata (User Tags).
- Tags are vectorized.
- **Cosine similarity** is calculated between user tag vector and each block.
- **Category weights** allow prioritizing certain dimensions (e.g., Goals > Preferences).

---

1. **Phase Display**

- User sees a **recommended sequence of phases** leading to their goal.
- Each phase contains **ranked training blocks** with relevance scores:
  - Overall Match Score
  - Breakdown by category (e.g., Goals: 0.93, Experience: 0.78, Style: 0.81)

---

1. **Block Selection or Refinement**

- User can:
  - Pick a block.
  - Add more personal info to improve match suggestions.
  - (Future feature) Review previous choices or change historical selections.
- Only the **current block** is selectable; future blocks are locked.

---

1. **Time Configuration**

- After choosing a block:
  - Day picker interface appears.
  - User sets daily hour limits and weekly total hours.

---

1. **Block Finalization**

- An **8-week block** is generated, unless event or phase transition is sooner.
- User can review, save, and **push to calendar**.

---

**Future Iterations (Not in MVP)**

- Edit history and previous selections view.
- Block editing post-commit.
- Daily adaptation (e.g., recovery-based changes).

card.desc:
3 factors affect a workouts scoring. CP, W', RPF and comparing it to the main work of the workout or the workout over all.

---

RPF Below

![image.png](https://trello.com/1/cards/68441cfe41a1b818c875a9b2/attachments/6846d1f10790a4e2710fedaa/download/image.png)

**+1.0The Pacer**Loves setting a hard, steady, relentless pace for a very long time.

**+0.5The Grinder**Prefers to put their head down and "grind out" a tough, sustained effort.

**0.0The All-Rounder**Adaptable, with no strong mental preference for any particular style of effort.

**-0.5The Surger**Feels most engaged by workouts with repeated surges and changes in pace.

**-1.0The Attacker**Thrives on the thrill of repeated, sharp, high-power attacks and sprints.

---

I have javascript and functions to calculate IDS based on passing in main work like in attached image (see below)

‌

Alex search Gemini for  “IDS - Workout Difficulty Scoring”

---

Here is how the scoring works out for reference.


[https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/169zKFAijVbwgMEUePYinnia-L_3fMFjmufJ1gQh1AJo/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/169zKFAijVbwgMEUePYinnia-L_3fMFjmufJ1gQh1AJo/edit?usp=sharing "smartCard-inline")

Alex will assign and IDF range to a workout progression.
card.name: USER_TAG: IDS - Individualized Difficulty Score for workouts
USER_TAG: IDS - Individualized Difficulty Score for workouts

old.desc:
3 factors affect a workouts scoring. CP, W', RPF and comparing it to the main work of the workout or the workout over all.

Rider Preference Factor (RPF)

- **RPF: The Metronome (+1.0)**
- **RPF: The Steady-Hand (+0.5)**
- **RPF: The Pragmatist (0.0)**
- **RPF: The Engaged Attacker (-0.5)**
- **RPF: The Instigator (-1.0)**

We need a way to easily see what the tags mean.
**The Metronome:** Prefers and mentally thrives on long, steady, rhythmic efforts.
**The Steady-Hand:** Leans towards preferring sustained work and feels most comfortable in a steady rhythm.
**The Pragmatist:** Has no strong mental preference; perceives difficulty based on the objective physical demand.
**The Engaged Attacker:** Prefers workouts with active changes in pace and intensity to stay mentally engaged.
**The Instigator:** Mentally thrives on high-intensity, stochastic, and frequently changing efforts.

I have javascript and functions to calculate IDS based on passing in main work like in attached image (see below)

Alex search Gemini for  “IDS - Workout Difficulty Scoring”

![image.png](https://trello.com/1/cards/68441cfe41a1b818c875a9b2/attachments/68441f475d2b4805e3334b44/download/image.png)

‌

Alex will assign and IDF range to a workout progression.

old.desc:
So just like Coach Jack we capture all this data.  This is even more data.  The LLM tries to get it all and if something is missing asks for more.  After phase 1 we can add strava data to fill some of it out.

Goal and time line (if event, event details)
Scheduling with location
Health Factors

- Current Recovery Status
- Injury/Illness
- Estimated recovery speed (age… health)

Training Status

- Last 8 weeks phase
- ETA to burnout
- Consistency Pattern and Duration
- Intensity Preference
- Phenotype
- Other Training / Riding
- Current equipment, dumb trainer, smart trainer, power meter outdoor, hr outdoor

Training Preferences

- Desired Intensity level
- Next plan type
- Periodization (indoor winter only for example)
- 2/1 or 3/1 recovery weeks
  \-

card.name: All User Attributes to capture

card.desc:
Please review all tags and descriptions to make sure they match you.  The better they match the better the plan will match you.  All our plans are good and will cause long term progress although some can be overly hard we try to avoid assigning those by default but if that is what you want you can have it.  If you can handle bigger suffering and it is safe for you, you will likely see short term rapid progress doing more intensity.  Long term continual gains are better via a more balanced approach.

We should tell the users some important stuff to pay attention to.

1. We recommend starting with a 12 week base plan which will be low intensity.  If you don’t want this change the tag Periodization: BaseOk to Base Not Ok
2. We believe you like moderate workouts and have assigned you a workout difficulty range of Moderate but since you are starting base it will be easy and build to moderate.
3. We have set your periodization to 3 month cycles of base, build and peak.  You can change this to 6 months or yearly.
4. ….
card.name: Explain to the user why and things to pay attention to

old.name: Give user feedback to make sure

- 2/1 or 3/1 recovery weeks

old.desc:
3 factors affect a workouts scoring. CP, W', RPF and comparing it to the main work of the workout or the workout over all.

Rider Preference Factor (RPF)

- **RPF: The Metronome (+1.0)**
- **RPF: The Steady-Hand (+0.5)**
- **RPF: The Pragmatist (0.0)**
- **RPF: The Engaged Attacker (-0.5)**
- **RPF: The Instigator (-1.0)**

‌

I have javascript and functions to calculate IDS based on passing in main work like in attached image (see below)

Alex search Gemini for  “IDS - Workout Difficulty Scoring”

‌

‌

![image.png](https://trello.com/1/cards/68441cfe41a1b818c875a9b2/attachments/68441f475d2b4805e3334b44/download/image.png)

card.desc:
3 factors affect a workouts scoring. CP, W', RPF and comparing it to the main work of the workout or the workout over all.

Rider Preference Factor (RPF)

- **RPF: The Metronome (+1.0)**
- **RPF: The Steady-Hand (+0.5)**
- **RPF: The Pragmatist (0.0)**
- **RPF: The Engaged Attacker (-0.5)**
- **RPF: The Instigator (-1.0)**

We need a way to easily see what the tags mean.
**The Metronome:** Prefers and mentally thrives on long, steady, rhythmic efforts.
**The Steady-Hand:** Leans towards preferring sustained work and feels most comfortable in a steady rhythm.
**The Pragmatist:** Has no strong mental preference; perceives difficulty based on the objective physical demand.
**The Engaged Attacker:** Prefers workouts with active changes in pace and intensity to stay mentally engaged.
**The Instigator:** Mentally thrives on high-intensity, stochastic, and frequently changing efforts.

I have javascript and functions to calculate IDS based on passing in main work like in attached image (see below)

Alex search Gemini for  “IDS - Workout Difficulty Scoring”

‌

‌

![image.png](https://trello.com/1/cards/68441cfe41a1b818c875a9b2/attachments/68441f475d2b4805e3334b44/download/image.png)

old.desc:
The LLM will determine if a user needs 2/1 or 3/1. LLM will determine total length of the plan.  We will have a function that breaks the plan into blocks.

Block Types
Base
Build
Peak
Transition (Take some time off)

We will focus on base/build/peak for now and plans up to 52 weeks.

All block will be these lengths
4, 8      for 3/1 recovery
3, 6, 9   for 2/1 recovery


So first we get the total weeks of each
base:16
build:12
peak:12
peak:event

But then we split into block lengths into 4 or 8. Like this
Example: 40 week plan - Base 8 + base 8 + build 8 + build 4 + peak 8 + peak 4

‌

we can have 16 weeks of base, build and peak+2 week transition. Don’t know how we will do the transition period yet.

So final output.
Plan Length: 40 Weeks (ends 7/1/2024)
Blocks:  Builder (Base 8w),  Jump Start (Base 8w) …
Personal Tags:
Goal Tags:
Other Tags: ….
Then show Tabs with each of the blocks and example workouts for each block.  First tab shows the first block and all the workouts similar to CJ calendar but might be 8 weeks not 4.

old.desc:
See below.  Seems like Version 2 is the right approach. This cost should be $.001 but obviously a user could describe a lot more but still the cost is very low with 4.1-mini.  The question is I would guess the resulting “tags” are not standardized. I would like to avoid forcing everything in to a small list but at the same time if it is not standardized at some level it will be harder to deal with.

Version 1

card.desc:
See below.  Seems like Version 2 is the right approach. This cost should be $.001 but obviously a user could describe a lot more but still the cost is very low with 4.1-mini.  The question is I would guess the resulting “tags” are not standardized. I would like to avoid forcing everything in to a small list but at the same time if it is not standardized at some level it will be harder to deal with.

Version 1

![image.png](https://trello.com/1/cards/68404ad1aaa0e7c99a220912/attachments/68404ad45a8a7ac79b6fa86f/download/image.png)

‌

Version 2

![image.png](https://trello.com/1/cards/68404ad1aaa0e7c99a220912/attachments/68405cb9d224379ac7c77b1f/download/image.png)

I attached an example schema and prompt is here

My goal is to lose weight and improve health. I can train about 5 hours a week. I sleep about 7.5 hours a night. I don't want to train too hard right now but want to ease into harder training soon because I don't feel I recover very quickly now if I do much intensity. No health issues that would affect my cycling but I am 58 and been inconsistent in my training so don't recover as well as possible. I am very inspired and active right now though.

Now when N/A or blank comes back on some of the required fields we should then ask a follow up question.  i.e.  “Can you provide a list of which days you can train on and any any daily or weekly time limitations.”

I need to update this schema.  Really we should ask all the stuff CJ asks for questions now including setting all limits.  We optionally could let people define their own list of blocks and block lengths for example.

card.name: Evaluation: Identify the "one thing" the user should focus on most and ultimately what drives the goal or training plan the most

card.desc:
Here are ideas from GPT that we might have to ask a few questions to get to verify these things.  Might start with a basic question.

Do you feel you have a clear problem that you are trying to solve with training?  We see that you seem to XYZ from your training data.

‌

**From Training Data:**

- **Consistency:** How regularly and frequently training occurs.
- **Training Volume:** Total amount of training (time, distance, or TSS).
- **Aerobic Base:** Time spent in low-intensity zones (e.g., Zone 2).
- **Intensity Distribution:** Balance between easy, moderate, and hard training.
- **High-Intensity Training:** Amount and quality of hard efforts/intervals.
- **Pacing:** Ability to maintain a steady effort without "blowing up."
- **Cadence:** Typical pedaling speed and its appropriateness for different situations.
- **Power Curve Weaknesses:** Specific durations where power output is relatively lower (e.g., sprint, 5-min power, FTP).

**From User Input (Questions):**

- **Primary Cycling Goal(s).**
- **Perceived Personal Weaknesses.**
- **Time Available for Training.**
- **Recent Training History** (if data is sparse).
- **Sleep Habits** (quantity and quality).
- **Basic Fueling/Hydration Practices** for rides.
- **Subjective Recovery Levels.**
- **Access to Equipment/Terrain** (trainer, hills, etc.).
- **Relevant Injury/Health History.**
- **Training Enjoyment/Motivation Factors.**
card.name: Identify the "one thing" the user should focus on most and ultimately what drives the goal or training plan the most

old.name: Identify the "one thing" the user should focus on most

card.name: Identify the "one thing" the user should focus on most and ultimately what drives the goal or training plan the most
Identify the "one thing" the user should focus on most

card.desc:
I realized it’s better to actually just do a chat style UI, make it work like Chat GPT.  We ask questions, just one after the next.  We try to get them to answer multiple at a time but if we are missing something we continue to ask.  Ideally we show some indicator of progress.

Minimum Questions (that you can't skip)

- The Primary Goal
- Current Cycling Activity Level (strava)
- Time Availability for Training
- If the Goal is Event-Specific add date and describe the event (type and distance)

The question could be… typed slowly in ChatGPT style so it looks like a bot is writing to me.

Hello Alex, I can see from Strava you are cycling consistent for a while now.  Can you tell me your primary goal for a cycling plan?  Also your day and time availability?

Check if all the required questions are answered if not ask and if they say a race make sure you have the details.

Then do the same with next level below but, say NEXT QUESTIONS > or Skip.  By answering a few more questions your plan can be much more tailored to you.  You can always do this later if you want.

Next level

- Health
- Cycling Gear (strava)
- Training Style & Preferences
- Current state of readiness - close to burn out
- Cycling Performance Profile
- Lifestyle & Recovery
- Specific Scheduling Needs
card.name: UI Ideas - V2 (better)

old.name: Coach Jack AI - Finding a plan

card.name: Coach Jack AI - Finding a plan

card.desc:
Plan Creation Phase

1. Initial evaluation turns conversation into rider profile with goals (I am thinking user tags/memory tree)

1. User reviews tags to make sure they make sense

1. High level Periodization created (weeks, block types, workout types)

1. Next 8 week schedule created

1. User provides feedback, adjustments might be made

‌

Daily adjustment phase

1. Adaptions via automatic calculation of todays workout based on rules. Adaptions show "Why"

1. User can provide feedback that might cause a small adjustment, at workout sequence intensity, workout duration or trigger a bigger plan change (are you sure you want to make these changes)

1. Today's workout or the sequence or entire plan are changed
card.name: Big Picture
Coach Jack AI - Finding a plan

old.desc:
Here is the concept behind the design of coach jack AI.  I think we should tell the user what the long term plan is “Base, Build, Peak details” just in text/visual format but then only provide workouts for the next 8 weeks.

Here is the idea

‌

- **Conversational Data Intake:** An LLM interacts with the user to gather information about their physical characteristics, training history, goals, life constraints, and mental factors.
- **User Profile Tagging:** The LLM processes this information and converts it into a standardized set of "user tags" that define the user's profile.
- **Tag Review & Confirmation:** The user is shown these generated tags and can review, edit, or confirm them for accuracy, ensuring the system's understanding is correct.
- **Curated Training Plan Database:** The system uses a pre-existing library of training plans, where each plan has been manually assigned a set of descriptive "plan tags" by domain experts (e.g., cycling coaches).
- **Matching Algorithm:** A similarity algorithm (like Cosine Similarity) compares the verified "user tags" against the "plan tags" in the database to find the most appropriate training plan(s).
- **Personalized Plan Recommendation:** The system outputs the best-matching training plan(s) to the user, based on the tag comparison.

‌

‌

![image.png](https://trello.com/1/cards/68380a09449c2c024eba4f52/attachments/6838114fc0de1ca17f0d45ca/download/image.png)

card.name: Coach Jack AI - Finding a plan

old.desc:
Here is the concept behind the design of coach jack AI.  I think we should tell the user what the long term plan is “Base, Build, Peak details” just in text/visual format but then only provide workouts for the next 8 weeks.

Here is the idea

‌

- **Conversational Data Intake:** An LLM interacts with the user to gather information about their physical characteristics, training history, goals, life constraints, and mental factors.
- **User Profile Tagging:** The LLM processes this information and converts it into a standardized set of "user tags" that define the user's profile.
- **Tag Review & Confirmation:** The user is shown these generated tags and can review, edit, or confirm them for accuracy, ensuring the system's understanding is correct.
- **Curated Training Plan Database:** The system uses a pre-existing library of training plans, where each plan has been manually assigned a set of descriptive "plan tags" by domain experts (e.g., cycling coaches).
- **Matching Algorithm:** A similarity algorithm (like Cosine Similarity) compares the verified "user tags" against the "plan tags" in the database to find the most appropriate training plan(s).
- **Personalized Plan Recommendation:** The system outputs the best-matching training plan(s) to the user, based on the tag comparison.

cards.name: CJ - Fix Cadence... and give instructions

cards.desc:
After answering questions show this.  Later when the questions are not shown skip it.  You should send an email to CRM and I will tell them how to change their Intensity / Ride feel.

---

When you are starting a NEW, it’s best to start at the beginning.  Your old plan is not the same as the new one. 

If you have time, we suggest you start at this lower intensity and let it build up.   You don’t need to kill yourself on day 1. You can increase the intensity now if you feel you must, or we will send an email in a few days after your plan starts and give instructures on how to increase it then if you want.

- Easily change Intensity & ride feel at any time

‌

‌

![image.png](https://trello.com/1/cards/67b0768ae878ce39a29e9fa0/attachments/67b0769f6b490249d3f73bec/download/image.png)

cards.name: BIG PICTURE USER FLOW (google doc)

cards.desc:
Here is a new question format.  What I think we can do is replace the coach jack questions with this style, but instead of open text LLM questions we can ask the couple of missing questions from CJ, Event duration or whatever is missing but used in the rules.

[https://claude.ai/public/artifacts/9295a409-89be-4ddf-a7d7-5a1ed38e8e13](https://claude.ai/public/artifacts/9295a409-89be-4ddf-a7d7-5a1ed38e8e13 "smartCard-inline")

So for AI version we will add LLM open text questions.  I think the question about how much are you training now can be skipped if they connect to strava, right?

I am getting Henry to design this visually in a style that better matches TD.

Remember these questions will need to live in borderless browser view in the app as soon as we have the AI/LLM part working.

We should save all the users choices and text they write and never discard it or over write it, although we could retain the history in more of a log format and just have the current info.  Overall they will have their original answers and incremental updates, although they will be able to start over and we show their original choices and they can over write those but I think it is still a good idea to retain the history as over time we can see how people evolve and eventually make AI much smarter.
cards.name: CJ - Update Questions

cards.desc:
So after asking the users questions.  We want to use an LLM to convert all the questions into user tags.  And display them so the user can verify and feel confident we understand him.

[https://claude.ai/public/artifacts/fa19aa59-4748-4471-95fe-23275db64e16](https://claude.ai/public/artifacts/fa19aa59-4748-4471-95fe-23275db64e16 "smartCard-inline")

Some tags will be custom just for this user and some will be generic tags.   Andrey will take all these tags and create the perfect plan for the user.  I will create a list of what the generic tags will be.  [Phase: Build] for example will be generic tag.

We should save all these tags and just like question retain the history.
cards.name: CJ - AI Summary (User Tags generated from LLM)
Add localization to questions and summary

cards.desc:
So just like Coach Jack we capture all this data.  This is even more data.  The LLM tries to get it all and if something is missing asks for more.  After phase 1 we can add strava data to fill some of it out.

Goal and time line (if event, event details)
Scheduling with location
Health Factors

- Current Recovery Status
- Injury/Illness
- Estimated recovery speed (age… health)

Training Status

- Last 8 weeks phase
- ETA to burnout
- Consistency Pattern and Duration
- Intensity Preference
- Phenotype
- Other Training / Riding
- Current equipment, dumb trainer, smart trainer, power meter outdoor, hr outdoor

Training Preferences

- Desired Intensity level
- Next plan type
- Periodization (indoor winter only for example)
- 2/1 or 3/1 recovery weeks
  

Affects training 
commuting, poor sleep, others?
cards.name: All User Attributes to capture

cards.desc:
3 factors affect a workouts scoring. CP, W', RPF and comparing it to the main work of the workout or the workout over all.

---

RPF Below

![image.png](https://trello.com/1/cards/68441cfe41a1b818c875a9b2/attachments/6846d1f10790a4e2710fedaa/download/image.png)

**+1.0The Pacer**Loves setting a hard, steady, relentless pace for a very long time.

**+0.5The Grinder**Prefers to put their head down and "grind out" a tough, sustained effort.

**0.0The All-Rounder**Adaptable, with no strong mental preference for any particular style of effort.

**-0.5The Surger**Feels most engaged by workouts with repeated surges and changes in pace.

**-1.0The Attacker**Thrives on the thrill of repeated, sharp, high-power attacks and sprints.

---

I have javascript and functions to calculate IDS based on passing in main work like in attached image (see below)

‌

Alex search Gemini for  “IDS - Workout Difficulty Scoring”

---

Here is how the scoring works out for reference.


[https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/169zKFAijVbwgMEUePYinnia-L_3fMFjmufJ1gQh1AJo/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/169zKFAijVbwgMEUePYinnia-L_3fMFjmufJ1gQh1AJo/edit?usp=sharing "smartCard-inline")

Alex will assign and IDF range to a workout progression.
cards.name: USER_TAG: IDS - Individualized Difficulty Score for workouts

cards.desc:
Please review all tags and descriptions to make sure they match you.  The better they match the better the plan will match you.  All our plans are good and will cause long term progress although some can be overly hard we try to avoid assigning those by default but if that is what you want you can have it.  If you can handle bigger suffering and it is safe for you, you will likely see short term rapid progress doing more intensity.  Long term continual gains are better via a more balanced approach.

We should tell the users some important stuff to pay attention to.

1. We recommend starting with a 12 week base plan which will be low intensity.  If you don’t want this change the tag Periodization: BaseOk to Base Not Ok
2. We believe you like moderate workouts and have assigned you a workout difficulty range of Moderate but since you are starting base it will be easy and build to moderate.
3. We have set your periodization to 3 month cycles of base, build and peak.  You can change this to 6 months or yearly.
4. ….
cards.name: Explain to the user why and things to pay attention to

cards.desc:
See below.  Seems like Version 2 is the right approach. This cost should be $.001 but obviously a user could describe a lot more but still the cost is very low with 4.1-mini.  The question is I would guess the resulting “tags” are not standardized. I would like to avoid forcing everything in to a small list but at the same time if it is not standardized at some level it will be harder to deal with.

Version 1

![image.png](https://trello.com/1/cards/68404ad1aaa0e7c99a220912/attachments/68404ad45a8a7ac79b6fa86f/download/image.png)

‌

Version 2

![image.png](https://trello.com/1/cards/68404ad1aaa0e7c99a220912/attachments/68405cb9d224379ac7c77b1f/download/image.png)

I attached an example schema and prompt is here

My goal is to lose weight and improve health. I can train about 5 hours a week. I sleep about 7.5 hours a night. I don't want to train too hard right now but want to ease into harder training soon because I don't feel I recover very quickly now if I do much intensity. No health issues that would affect my cycling but I am 58 and been inconsistent in my training so don't recover as well as possible. I am very inspired and active right now though.

Now when N/A or blank comes back on some of the required fields we should then ask a follow up question.  i.e.  “Can you provide a list of which days you can train on and any any daily or weekly time limitations.”

I need to update this schema.  Really we should ask all the stuff CJ asks for questions now including setting all limits.  We optionally could let people define their own list of blocks and block lengths for example.
cards.name: Example First Prompt

cards.desc:
The LLM will determine if a user needs 2/1 or 3/1. LLM will determine total length of the plan.  We will have a function that breaks the plan into blocks.

Block Types
Base
Build
Peak
Transition (Take some time off)

We will focus on base/build/peak for now and plans up to 52 weeks.

All block will be these lengths
4, 8      for 3/1 recovery
3, 6, 9   for 2/1 recovery

So first we get the total weeks of each
base:16
build:12
peak:12
peak:event

But then we split into block lengths into 4 or 8. Like this
Example: 40 week plan - Base 8 + base 8 + build 8 + build 4 + peak 8 + peak 4

‌

we can have 16 weeks of base, build and peak+2 week transition. Don’t know how we will do the transition period yet.


So final output.
Plan Length: 40 Weeks (ends 7/1/2024)
Blocks:  Builder (Base 8w),  Jump Start (Base 8w) …
Personal Tags:
Goal Tags:
Other Tags: ….
Then show Tabs with each of the blocks and example workouts for each block.  First tab shows the first block and all the workouts similar to CJ calendar but might be 8 weeks not 4.
cards.name: Periodization Function

cards.desc: Understanding how a person likes to train and what they expect.  Can they sacrifice short term goals for smarter long term goals or do they only want immediate results via hard work.
cards.name: Evaluation - Preferences

cards.desc:
Plan Creation Phase

1. Initial evaluation turns conversation into rider profile with goals (I am thinking user tags/memory tree)

1. User reviews tags to make sure they make sense

1. High level Periodization created (weeks, block types, workout types)

1. Next 8 week schedule created

1. User provides feedback, adjustments might be made

‌

Daily adjustment phase

1. Adaptions via automatic calculation of todays workout based on rules. Adaptions show "Why"

1. User can provide feedback that might cause a small adjustment, at workout sequence intensity, workout duration or trigger a bigger plan change (are you sure you want to make these changes)

1. Today's workout or the sequence or entire plan are changed
cards.name: Epic - Create + Optimize

cards.desc:
Here is the concept behind the design of coach jack AI.  I think we should tell the user what the long term plan is “Base, Build, Peak details” just in text/visual format but then only provide workouts for the next 8 weeks.

Here is the idea

‌

- **Conversational Data Intake:** An LLM interacts with the user to gather information about their physical characteristics, training history, goals, life constraints, and mental factors.
- **User Profile Tagging:** The LLM processes this information and converts it into a standardized set of "user tags" that define the user's profile.
- **Tag Review & Confirmation:** The user is shown these generated tags and can review, edit, or confirm them for accuracy, ensuring the system's understanding is correct.
- **Curated Training Plan Database:** The system uses a pre-existing library of training plans, where each plan has been manually assigned a set of descriptive "plan tags" by domain experts (e.g., cycling coaches).
- **Matching Algorithm:** A similarity algorithm (like Cosine Similarity) compares the verified "user tags" against the "plan tags" in the database to find the most appropriate training plan(s).
- **Personalized Plan Recommendation:** The system outputs the best-matching training plan(s) to the user, based on the tag comparison.
cards.name: Epic - Creating a plan

cards.desc: Understand what a user wants.  Event, health, weight loss.
cards.name: Evaluation - Goals

cards.desc:
I realized it’s better to actually just do a chat style UI, make it work like Chat GPT.  We ask questions, just one after the next.  We try to get them to answer multiple at a time but if we are missing something we continue to ask.  Ideally we show some indicator of progress.

Minimum Questions (that you can't skip)

- The Primary Goal
- Current Cycling Activity Level (strava)
- Time Availability for Training
- If the Goal is Event-Specific add date and describe the event (type and distance)

The question could be… typed slowly in ChatGPT style so it looks like a bot is writing to me.

Hello Alex, I can see from Strava you are cycling consistent for a while now.  Can you tell me your primary goal for a cycling plan?  Also your day and time availability?

Check if all the required questions are answered if not ask and if they say a race make sure you have the details.

Then do the same with next level below but, say NEXT QUESTIONS > or Skip.  By answering a few more questions your plan can be much more tailored to you.  You can always do this later if you want.

Next level

- Health
- Cycling Gear (strava)
- Training Style & Preferences
- Current state of readiness - close to burn out
- Cycling Performance Profile
- Lifestyle & Recovery
- Specific Scheduling Needs
cards.name: UI Ideas - V2 (better)
Evaluation - Limiters: Training time, training days, recovery

cards.desc: Once we have a clear sense of what the user needs we should match that up with plans.   We might have some tags that are hard coded… Like if a persons doctor suggests low intensity they should only get low intensity.  I am not sure how many cases their are like this.
cards.name: Plan Match - User Tags vs Plan Tags

cards.desc:
Here are ideas from GPT that we might have to ask a few questions to get to verify these things.  Might start with a basic question.

Do you feel you have a clear problem that you are trying to solve with training?  We see that you seem to XYZ from your training data.

‌

**From Training Data:**

- **Consistency:** How regularly and frequently training occurs.
- **Training Volume:** Total amount of training (time, distance, or TSS).
- **Aerobic Base:** Time spent in low-intensity zones (e.g., Zone 2).
- **Intensity Distribution:** Balance between easy, moderate, and hard training.
- **High-Intensity Training:** Amount and quality of hard efforts/intervals.
- **Pacing:** Ability to maintain a steady effort without "blowing up."
- **Cadence:** Typical pedaling speed and its appropriateness for different situations.
- **Power Curve Weaknesses:** Specific durations where power output is relatively lower (e.g., sprint, 5-min power, FTP).

**From User Input (Questions):**

- **Primary Cycling Goal(s).**
- **Perceived Personal Weaknesses.**
- **Time Available for Training.**
- **Recent Training History** (if data is sparse).
- **Sleep Habits** (quantity and quality).
- **Basic Fueling/Hydration Practices** for rides.
- **Subjective Recovery Levels.**
- **Access to Equipment/Terrain** (trainer, hills, etc.).
- **Relevant Injury/Health History.**
- **Training Enjoyment/Motivation Factors.**
cards.name: Evaluation-Primary Focus: Identify the "one thing" the user should focus on most and ultimately what drives the goal or training plan the most
